io.mpos.transactions
Enum Currency

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<Currency>
      io.mpos.transactions.Currency
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Currency>
public enum Currency
extends java.lang.Enum<Currency>

The currency used for a transaction. Offers convenient access to ISO 4217 standard definitions such as name and number.

Since:
2.0.0

Enum Constant Detail

UNKNOWN

public static final Currency UNKNOWN
An unknown currency. Is actually part of the ISO standard, but should be treated as an error.

values

public static Currency[] values()
Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
for (Currency c : Currency.values())
    System.out.println(c);

Returns:
an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

valueOf

public static Currency valueOf(java.lang.String name)
Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)

Parameters:

Returns:
the enum constant with the specified name
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

formatAmount

public java.lang.String formatAmount(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
Formats an amount for this currency without adding any symbol.

Parameters:
amount - The amount to be formatted.
Returns:
A formatted String using the '.' as decimal separator.

formatAmountWithSymbol

public java.lang.String formatAmountWithSymbol(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
Formats an amount for this currency with adding its symbol.

Parameters:
amount - The amount to be formatted.
Returns:
A formatted String using the '.' as decimal separator.

getFormatString

public java.lang.String getFormatString()
Returns a string that can be used to format display a currency. It contains the currency symbol as a prefix or suffix and '%s' marks where the decimal number should be inserted.

See String.format(...) for more information on how to use this format string.

Returns:
A valid String format that can be used to format a string argument.
Since:
2.0.0

getLongDescription

public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
Returns the official name of the currency.

Returns:
The official name
Since:
2.0.0

getIsoCode

public java.lang.String getIsoCode()
Returns the official ISO 4217 code for the currency.

Returns:
The ISO 4217 code having a length of 3
Since:
2.0.0

getIsoNumber

public int getIsoNumber()
Returns the official ISO 4217 number for the currency.

Returns:
The ISO 4217 number
Since:
2.0.0

getCurrencyExponent

public int getCurrencyExponent()
Returns the currency exponent. This is usually the number of post-decimal places.

Returns:
The currency exponent
Since:
2.0.0

isValidCurrency

public boolean isValidCurrency()
Checks if this is a valid currency.

Returns:
True iff this is a valid currency
Since:
2.0.0
